snippet: Members of a conservation corps came from Washington and other states to help clear fallen trees and storm debris, but found themselves caring for people with special needs in Brooklyn.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on Peter Nevin, Emily Chilton and Daniel Vladu, who came from Washington State as volunteers with AmeriCorps aiming to help clear fallen trees and debris from Hurricane Sandy, but instead ended up helping run a shelter in Fort Greene, Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: Members of a conservation corps came from Washington and other states to help clear fallen trees and storm debris, but found themselves caring for people with special needs in Brooklyn.

headline.seo: Out-of-Town Volunteers Help Run a Brooklyn Shelter
headline.main: Driving Cross-Country to Clean Up Debris, but Adapting to Help Run a Shelter
headline.print_headline: Driving Cross-Country to Clean Up Debris, but Adapting to Help Run a Shelter

keywords.value: Corp for National and Community Service
keywords.name: organizations
